result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:53 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Christian M Weber appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Christian M Weber, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.

2:53 pm - Information brought over. 

Court reviews preliminary questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Atty Richards waives reading of the information. Defendant plead not guilty to all 3 counts. Clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each of the 3 counts.

1:20 PM Defendant Christian M Weber appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause.

DA Requests a $1000.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.
